newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY'S BRAU UNION BOOSTS MARKET SHARE.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY'S BRAU UNION BOOSTS MARKET SHARE.

text.p: Hungary's Brau Union Hungaria Kft, exclusive distributor for breweries Soproni Sorgyar and Martfu has boosted its market share in the first nine months of 1996 amid a general decline in the domestic beer market, Brau Union Hungaria said on Wednesday.

Brau Union, set up at the beginning of 1996 with 60-40 ownership by Sopron and Martfu, boosted its market share to 21.4 percent from the two breweries' combined 19 percent stake in the same period of 1995, Soproni said in its results report.
Brau sold 1.21 million hectolitres of beer in the first nine months of 1996, 4.4 percent more than the joint sale of Soproni and Martfu in the same period of last year.
Soproni itself sold 817,000 hectolitres of beer to Brau.

The report cited data of the Association of Hungarian Breweries which said that the Hungarian beer market shrank by seven percent in the January-September period of this year over the same period of 1995.
Soproni released its consolidated January-September of 1996 results this morning and reported an operating profit of 767.8 million forints on net sales of 11.36 billion forints.
Soproni and Martfu are both majority-owned by Austria's Brau Union AG.
